description: An underwater island located 10,000 meters below sea level beneath the Red Line. Home to fish-men and merfolk, protected by a massive bubble and historically guarded by powerful pirates.

keyEvents.title: Citizens Trust Luffy to Save Them
keyEvents.description: The citizens of Fish-Man Island cheer for Luffy to destroy Noah and save them, showing their complete faith in a human pirate despite their history of discrimination.
keyEvents.significance: Represents a turning point in human-fish-man relations and the citizens' acceptance of Luffy as their savior.

keyEvents.title: Sea Kings Save the Island
keyEvents.description: Six massive Sea Kings appear and halt Noah's descent, preventing the destruction of Fish-Man Island in response to Shirahoshi's unconscious summons.
keyEvents.significance: The island is saved from destruction through Shirahoshi's awakened power as Poseidon.

statusHistory.reason: Noah was descending toward the island and threatened to destroy it
Noah was stopped by Sea Kings, saving the island from destruction

description: An enormous ancient ship known as the 'Ship of Promise' created during the Void Century. It was promised to be kept safe for Joy Boy's eventual return. The ship is half the size of Fish-Man Island itself.

keyEvents.title: Luffy's Elephant Gatling Assault
keyEvents.description: Luffy unleashes a relentless barrage of Elephant Gatling attacks on Noah in an attempt to destroy it before it crashes into Fish-Man Island.
keyEvents.significance: Shows the desperation of the situation and Luffy's determination to save Fish-Man Island, even if it means destroying an ancient artifact.

keyEvents.title: Neptune's Apology to Joy Boy
keyEvents.description: King Neptune apologizes to Joy Boy for having to break the 800-year-old promise to keep Noah safe, revealing the ship's deep historical significance.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes Noah's connection to Joy Boy and the Void Century, linking it to ancient promises and prophecies.

keyEvents.title: Sea Kings Halt Noah
keyEvents.description: Six massive Sea Kings grab Noah's chains and bring the ship to a complete stop, preventing its descent and saving both the ship and Fish-Man Island.
keyEvents.significance: Noah is preserved for its eventual purpose, fulfilling the ancient promise while also saving Fish-Man Island.

statusHistory.reason: Hody Jones used Sea Kings to pull Noah toward Fish-Man Island
Stopped by Sea Kings but damaged by Luffy's Elephant Gatling attacks
